member.name: T:ExpressionPowerTools.Core.Comparisons.DefaultComparisonRules
member.summary: Default set of rules to use.

remarks.para: The documentation for each rule has remarks that detail the application of the rule.
When documentation refers to "are similar" it means the similarity rules are applied to the child expressions. Types are similar if one is assignable to the other.
Is a part of refers to the expression tree. For example, a take might be buried inside an include, but a top level take will pass "is part of" an expression with a nest take.

member.name: F:ExpressionPowerTools.Core.Comparisons.DefaultComparisonRules.cache
member.summary: Internal cache of compiled rules.

member.name: M:ExpressionPowerTools.Core.Comparisons.DefaultComparisonRules.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:ExpressionPowerTools.Core.Comparisons.DefaultComparisonRules.DefaultConstantRules
member.summary: Gets the rules for equivalency of .
member.remarks: Must be of same type. Both must be null or not null. If the value is an expression, the expressions must be equivalent. If the values are enumerable, the contents of the enumerable must match. The values must pass .

member.name: P:ExpressionPowerTools.Core.Comparisons.DefaultComparisonRules.DefaultConstantSimilarities
member.summary: Gets the default rule for similarities between constants.
member.remarks: Type type of the values must be assignable to each other. Both values must either be null or not null. If the values are expressions, the expressions must be similar. If array, collection, or enumerable then the expressions are similar regardless of the contents. Otherwise, must pass .

member.name: P:ExpressionPowerTools.Core.Comparisons.DefaultComparisonRules.DefaultLambdaRules
member.summary: Gets the default rules for lambda.
member.remarks: The name of the lambda expressions must be equal. The main expression body must be equivalent between the source and target, and if one is tail call optimized, the other must be, too.

member.name: P:ExpressionPowerTools.Core.Comparisons.DefaultComparisonRules.DefaultLambdaSimilarities
member.summary: Gets the default similarities for lambda.
member.remarks: The name must match, the count of parameters must match, and parameters must be similar. The source expression must be part of the target expression.

member.name: P:ExpressionPowerTools.Core.Comparisons.DefaultComparisonRules.DefaultInvocationRules
member.summary: Gets the default rules for invocations.
member.remarks: The return types must match. The expressions must be equivalent. All arguments must be equivalent.

member.name: P:ExpressionPowerTools.Core.Comparisons.DefaultComparisonRules.DefaultInvocationSimilarities
member.summary: Gets the default similarities for lambda.
member.remarks: The return types must be similar. Argument counts must match and all arguments must be similar. The source expression must be part of the target expression.

member.name: P:ExpressionPowerTools.Core.Comparisons.DefaultComparisonRules.DefaultMethodRules
member.summary: Gets the default rules for method calls.
member.remarks: The types must match. The method name and declaring type must match. If the Object property is not null, the properties must be equivalent. The source and target must have equivalent count of arguments and each argument must be equivalent.

member.name: P:ExpressionPowerTools.Core.Comparisons.DefaultComparisonRules.DefaultMethodSimilarities
member.summary: Gets the defeault rules for method call similarities.
member.remarks: The types must be similar. The name and count of arguments must be equal. If the Object property exists, the source object must be part of the target. Arguments must be similar.

member.name: P:ExpressionPowerTools.Core.Comparisons.DefaultComparisonRules.DefaultMemberRules
member.summary: Gets the default rules for member equivalency.
member.remarks: Must be the same type, have the same name and declaring type. If the member has an expression, the source and target expressions must be equivalent.

member.name: P:ExpressionPowerTools.Core.Comparisons.DefaultComparisonRules.DefaultMemberSimilarities
member.summary: Gets the default rules for member similarity.
member.remarks: The the types must be similar. Names and declarity types must be equal. If the expression is not null, the source must be part of the target.

member.name: P:ExpressionPowerTools.Core.Comparisons.DefaultComparisonRules.DefaultUnaryRules
member.summary: Gets the default rules for unaries.
member.remarks: The types, node type, "is lifted" flag, "is lifted to null" flag must be equal. If the method is not null, the method name and declaring type must match. The operands must be equivalent.

member.name: P:ExpressionPowerTools.Core.Comparisons.DefaultComparisonRules.DefaultUnarySimilarities
member.summary: Gets the default rules for unary similarities.
member.remarks: The node types must match, the methods, if they exist, must have the same name and similar declaring type. The source operand must be part of the target operand.

member.name: P:ExpressionPowerTools.Core.Comparisons.DefaultComparisonRules.DefaultBinaryRules
member.summary: Gets the default rules for binaries.
member.remarks: The node types (i.e. "Greater than", "Equals", etc.) must be equal. The left and right expressions must both be equivalent.

member.name: P:ExpressionPowerTools.Core.Comparisons.DefaultComparisonRules.DefaultBinarySimilarities
member.summary: Gets the default rules for binary similarities.
member.remarks: The node types must be equal. The left and right expressions must be similar.

member.name: P:ExpressionPowerTools.Core.Comparisons.DefaultComparisonRules.DefaultParameterRules
member.summary: Gets the default rules for parameters.
member.remarks: The type, name, and "by reference" flags must all be equal.

member.name: P:ExpressionPowerTools.Core.Comparisons.DefaultComparisonRules.DefaultParameterSimilarities
member.summary: Gets the default rules for parameter similarities.
member.remarks: The types must be similar.

member.name: P:ExpressionPowerTools.Core.Comparisons.DefaultComparisonRules.DefaultNewArrayRules
member.summary: Gets the default rules for new arrays.
member.remarks: The types must be equal. Each expression in the source array must have an equivalnet expression in the target array.

member.name: P:ExpressionPowerTools.Core.Comparisons.DefaultComparisonRules.DefaultNewArraySimilarities
member.summary: Gets the default rules for new array similarities.
member.remarks: Types must be similar. Each expression in the source must have a similar expression in the target.

member.name: P:ExpressionPowerTools.Core.Comparisons.DefaultComparisonRules.DefaultNewRules
member.summary: Gets the default rules for object initializers.
member.remarks: The types must be equal. The constructors must be identical (i.e. not a different override). The constuctor arguments must be equivalent.

member.name: P:ExpressionPowerTools.Core.Comparisons.DefaultComparisonRules.DefaultNewSimilarities
member.summary: Gets the default rules for object initializer similarities.
member.remarks: The types must be similar, parameters and arguments must be similar.

member.name: P:ExpressionPowerTools.Core.Comparisons.DefaultComparisonRules.DefaultMemberInitRules
member.summary: Gets the default rules for member initializers.
member.remarks: The types must be equal. The expression for initialization must be equivalent. All bindings must be equivalent.

member.name: P:ExpressionPowerTools.Core.Comparisons.DefaultComparisonRules.DefaultMemberInitSimilarities
member.summary: Gets the default rules for member initializer similarites.
member.remarks: The types must be similar. The expression for initialization must be similar. All bindings must be similar.

member.name: T:ExpressionPowerTools.Core.Comparisons.DefaultHighPerformanceRules
member.summary: This version is named "tongue-in-cheek" due to the assumption that code will outperform compiled expressions. Although that can be true, and this is included for testing as well as referencing if it helps with application scale, you should find the rules-based works fine for most scenarios and performs close to par with the programmed verssion.

member.name: M:ExpressionPowerTools.Core.Comparisons.DefaultHighPerformanceRules.LambdasAreEquivalent(System.Linq.Expressions.LambdaExpression,System.Linq.Expressions.LambdaExpression)
member.summary: Determine whether two lambdas are equivalent.
member.remarks: Two lambda expressions are equivalent when they share the same type, name, tail call optimization, parameter count, and when both body and parameters are equivalent.
member.returns: A flag indicating whether the two expressions are equivalent.

member.summary: Determine whether two methods are equivalent.
member.remarks: Two metods are equivalent when they share the same return type, the same declaring type, the same name, are either both instance or static fields, and all arguments pass equivalency.
member.returns: A flag indicating whether the two expressions are equivalent.

member.summary: Determine whether two members are equivalent.
member.remarks: Two instances of are equivalent when they share the same type (this will match the member type), the same declaring type, the same name, and if there is an expression, the expressions are equivalent.
member.returns: A flag indicating whether the two expressions are equivalent.

member.summary: Determines whether two unaries are equivalent.
member.remarks: Two instances of are equivalent when they share the same , method information, and when their operands pass equivalency.
member.returns: A flag that indicates whether the two expressions are equivalent.

member.summary: Determines whether two binaries are equivalent.
member.remarks: Two instances of are equivalent when they share the same and the recursive determination of the left expressoin and the right expressions is equivalent.
member.returns: A flag that indicates whether the two expressions are equivalent.

member.remarks: Two metods are similar when they share the same return type, declaring type, the same name, are either both instance or static fields, and all arguments pass similarity. member.summary: Method to compare two instances.

member.name: T:ExpressionPowerTools.Core.Dependencies.ServiceHost
member.summary: Host to obtain services.

remarks.para: This is a very simple dependency injection container. It allows registration of type implementations, generic implementations, and singletons. It does not recursively resolve dependencies. Registration happens in the call to and can only be done once. is provided mainly for testing purposes.
Satellite assemblies can hook into the registration by implementing . This is scanned and loaded before user overridees.
The provided by initialization is chainable (each call returns itself).

member.name: M:ExpressionPowerTools.Core.Extensions.ExpressionRulesExtensions.If``1(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,``0,System.Boolean}},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,``0,System.Boolean}},System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0,``0,System.Boolean}})
member.summary: Enables if ... then logic.
member.remarks: Since the logic is Boolean, the statement always returns a bool. If the condition is true, it evaluates to the result of the ifThen condition. If the condition is false, it evaluates to the result of the ifFalse condition. The ifFalse condition evaluates to true by default so it can be part of an "AND" chain. If it is part of an "OR" chain, you should override ifFalse to return false.
member.param: The rule to apply for success.
The rule to apply for failure.
member.returns: The result of the if/then/else evaluation.

member.summary: Enables if ... then logic with a cast to inner evaluations.
member.remarks: This special version allows transitioning from a parent expression to a child. For example, consider a with a for the Left property. This rule enables you to test if the type matches, then run rules against the child . See the definition for more about how the final result is evaluated.
member.param: How to convert to the type (property and cast).
The rule to apply for success.
The rule to apply for failure.
member.returns: The result of the if/then/else evaluation.
